cutter.tools

Class MultiTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • cutter.tools.MultiTool

  • public class MultiTool
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is intended to be a "developer's swiss knife" providing simple and helpful functionalities for many purposes
    Author:
    Phil Niehus

      static boolean addedToStartup()
      This method checks wether the currently running program has been added to startup or not
      static void addJarToStartup(java.lang.String programPath, java.lang.String startupScriptName)
      This method adds the specific .jar to the Windows startup, using a script called [startUpScriptName].bat
      static void addThisToStartup()
      This method adds the currently running Java program to the Windows startup
      static void executeAfterStartup()
      This method should be called to kill the blank commandline after automated startup Don't worry, this doesn't affect any other commandlines, because it kills only the one with the right PID
      static java.lang.String getAppDataPath()
      This method helps to get the path of the AppData folder

      Returns the absolute path of the currently running .jar

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPrintReadyDriveSpaceList()

      • removeJarFromStartup

        public static void removeJarFromStartup(java.lang.String startupScriptName)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This method removes the specified Script from the Windows startup
        Parameters:
        startUpScriptName - the name of your startup script without extension
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws an Exception when called on non-Windows systems or when the startup file doesn't exist

      • addJarToStartup

        public static void addJarToStartup(java.lang.String programPath,
                                   java.lang.String startupScriptName)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        This method adds the specific .jar to the Windows startup, using a script called [startUpScriptName].bat
        Parameters:
        programPath - The absolute path of the .jar-file which will be added to startup
        startUpScriptName - The name of the created startup-script (without extension)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws an Exception on non-Windows systems

      • getJarPath

        public static java.lang.String getJarPath()
        Returns the absolute path of the currently running .jar
        Returns:
        The absolute path of the running .jar as String

      • getAppDataPath

        public static java.lang.String getAppDataPath()
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This method helps to get the path of the AppData folder
        Returns:
        The path to the AppData folder
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws an Exception if the method is called on a non-Windows system

      • executeAfterStartup

        public static void executeAfterStartup()
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        This method should be called to kill the blank commandline after automated startup Don't worry, this doesn't affect any other commandlines, because it kills only the one with the right PID
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
